translation: Well, I’d like to talk about a question I ask myself, as the title goes, who is the winner of life.
transcript: 好的，我跟大家来讲一个，就像我的标题一样，我给自己设的这个问题，说：谁会是生活的胜利者。

translation: Fundamentally, all through our life, we are trying to find answer to three questions.
transcript: 其实人生回答的三个问题，都一样那三个问题。

translation: Where am I from?
transcript: 你从哪里来？

translation: Who am I?
transcript: 你是谁？

translation: Where am I going?
transcript: 你到哪里去哟？

translation: To define the winner of life is to answer the question of “where to go”.
transcript: 谁会是生活的胜利者？那就是回答的那样一个问题：你要往哪里去。

translation: I guess we all have our own answers.
transcript: 其实可能大家都有我都有自己的答案吧。

translation: At least I have.
transcript: 起码对于我来讲。

translation: But I am here not because I know the answer.
transcript: 其实我我真的来这里，我并不是因为我知道这个答案。

translation: Actually I don’t know the answer.
transcript: 对，答案我真的并不知道。

translation: But I tried to answer it.
transcript: 那么，但是我曾经也做过一些给自己尝试过给出一些回答。

translation: I graduated here.
transcript: 我是这个大学毕业的。

translation: I was a student here since 1995.
transcript: 九五年的时候，我进这个大学来读书。

translation: Before then I had set a goal for myself and thought I would be a winner of life when I made it.
transcript: 在那之前的时候，我给过自己一个，给过自己一个目标：我希望我那天我知道得到这个做到这一点的时候，我就会是生活的胜利者。

translation: I dreamt of becoming a writer.
transcript: 我希望我是一个作家。

translation: Why?
transcript: 原因是什么呢？

translation: Because I was born in the 1970s when there was no such things as mobile phones.
transcript: 是因为我在我们在我我一个七十年代出生的人，我们那个时候没有手机，没有。

translation: I didn't even have a TV until I was in middle school.
transcript: 我电视都是在读到中学的时候才有。

translation: Back then, only through literature could we attain to the widest world.
transcript: 所以我们会认为，那个时候，我我有一天能有我们知道文学是我们那个时候人最大的世界了。

translation: And I thought if one day I could have my own work published, my name would be known to many.
transcript: 我希望我有一天我能有一本书写出来，我的名字能被很多很多人能知道。

translation: That would be my biggest success.
transcript: 这就是我，人生最大的成功。

translation: Then at this university, I got acquainted with students from across the country and overseas and I got to know how big the world is out there.
transcript: 当我进到这个大学的时候，我发现这个同学们来自五湖四海，我知道世界原来这么大。

translation: I hoped to travel across the globe to see more of the world.
transcript: 我会希望自己将来能够去走遍世界，能够把世界都看遍。

translation: Later, the Internet came to China.
transcript: 再后来，在互联网来到了中国。

translation: And Bill Gates came to our campus to promote his book The Road Ahead.
transcript: 我们读书的时候比尔盖茨来到咱们学校，为他的那一本书做推广，那本书的名字叫《未来之路》。

translation: He immediately aroused a sensation among students.
transcript: 于是我们的所有的同学都疯了。

translation: We all wanted to become someone like Bill Gate who could change the world.
transcript: 我们都认为自己将来应该去做的事情就只有一件事情，就是像比尔盖茨一样，去改变世界。

translation: Yes, We wanted to change the world, travel around the world and conquer the world so that our names could be known to all.
transcript: 对，改变世界，环游世界，征服世界，对吧，让自己的名字被所有人都知道。

translation: We believed that if we could accomplish any of the above dreams, we would be a winner of life.
transcript: 这就是我们，做到任何一件这个事情可能我们都会觉得自己可以称之为生活的胜利者。

translation: Yes, I used to set such goals.
transcript: 我给自己设定过这些目标。

translation: So I abandoned my dream of becoming a writer, and suspended the idea of traveling around the world.
transcript: 于是我把我作家梦抛掉，把我环游世界的想法搁下。

translation: I decided to start my own business, make it go public and go as big as it can.
transcript: 然后我要去做一个做一个公司，要去上上市，要去往前走，要做到多大多大，我这样去做。

translation: Looking back, it was all something of a fluke.
transcript: 有时候想想想真的是命运机巧，就是命运真的是兜兜转转。

translation: Life's full of twists and turns that are hard to explain.
transcript: 有时候也说不清楚是怎么一回事哦。

translation: At the age of 36 two years ago, I kind of realized the goals I had set.
transcript: 前年的时候我36岁，那年的时候我曾经给自己设想的目标，都小小地得到了一点实现。

translation: I published a book entitled A Short Flight.
transcript: 我出版了一本书叫《短暂飞行》。

translation: Just one month ago its traditional Chinese version was published in Taiwan.
transcript: 一个月之前它在台湾刚出版。

translation: Last week I attended the book launch in Taipei.
transcript: 上个星期我在台北刚刚参加了繁体版的发布会。

translation: To my surprise, some people love it, which makes me really happy.
transcript: 居然有那么一些人喜欢，我还很开心，真的。

translation: It actually sells well.
transcript: 居然卖得掉。

translation: Wow!
transcript: 呵呵！

translation: Whenever I am called a writer, I feel even happier, although I’m just an amateur one.
transcript: 也有人会称为我是作家，呵呵，那我更开心了，呵呵，虽然是一个业余的，呵呵。

translation: Also two years ago, I had one more company successfully listed on Nasdaq.
transcript: 然后呢，我又有一个公司在前年的时候上市了居然，在纳斯达克。

translation: The thing is, when you made it, you discovered your peers also did so.
transcript: 但那真的是，当你上市的时候，发现你周围的朋友都上市了。

translation: Just now, at the hall gate I actually met an old pal who also owns a listed company.
transcript: 刚才在门口碰见一个，公司也上市了。

translation: So, I didn’t want to show off my IPO record anymore.
transcript: 所以我就再也不提我曾经做过一个上市公司这件事情。

translation: Then, I wanted to travel around the world.
transcript: 咳，我想去环游世界。

translation: To this end, I set a few targets for myself, including setting foot on five continents.
transcript: 然后呢我也给自己设定了一些目标，我要把五大洲先走遍。

translation: I might not be able to visit every country one by one, but at least I could fly to major continents, where I could travel around by bicycle.
transcript: 虽然不能每个国家都挨着走，那我还可以我可以起码先去占个地儿，然后呢我骑着自行车四处跑。

translation: By 2013, I had cycled through the most beautiful road on each of the five continents.
transcript: 刚好到2013年的时候，我在五大洲都骑过了最美的一条路。

translation: By “most beautiful”, I mean the most beautiful in my eyes.
transcript: 都是我自己定义的说最美，我说它最美它就是最美的。

translation: Well, I had cycled through 11 to 12 countries.
transcript: 对，我骑车骑过了十一二个国家吧。

translation: When I finished it, I somehow had a sense of achievement.
transcript: 我好像觉得我那一天的时候做到了一些事情。

translation: But a sudden void hit me on December 31, 2013.
transcript: 但等到在2013年12月31号的时候。

translation: And I felt myself shallow and ridiculous.
transcript: 我觉得我好茫然，我觉得自己是多么的浅薄和可笑。

translation: Because I realized my previous goals were based on how others looked on me.
transcript: 因为当我们原来设定了一些东西的时候都发现它是针对于别人的看法而定的。

translation: For example, to launch a successful IPO, you will have to persuade all relevant parties that your company has everything required to be an ideal IPO.
transcript: 你IPO就是要所有的人都认为这个公司是合适于IPO，它的公属于一个公共公司它才让你IPO。

translation: In other words, you have a publicly visible fortune.
transcript: 于是你有了一个公众可见的财富。

translation: But that does not prove anything more than your business sense and your good luck of seizing the opportunity.
transcript: 但是那个东西，第一它并不能够证明你个人怎么样，你无非曾经有过一些商业的能力，然后在一些在合适的一个时机里边做了一些恰巧对的事情而已。

translation: Is that you?
transcript: 那就是你吗？

translation: When you are in a bank or a supermarket, all clerks there know who you are.
transcript: 然后你去银行你去超市里面买东西的时候收银员都能认得你。

translation: So what?
transcript: 那是他们认得你？

translation: Do you know yourself?
transcript: 可是你认得你自己吗？

translation: Can you sleep tight at night?
transcript: 你那个人让你睡觉的时候安心吗？

translation: Travelling around the world.
transcript: 走遍世界。

translation: I have a couple of friends who have been to some 100 countries.
transcript: 在我的身边有那么几个朋友，去过接近一百个国家。

translation: They may not be known to the public, but they are always on the way.
transcript: 他们不是被所有人知道的那些人，可是他们永远走不完。

translation: I have a very close friend who’s a veteran traveller.
transcript: 我曾经问我其中一个最好的一个旅行家的朋友。

translation: I once told him that I read one of his articles, a very nice piece, which answered a question I had wanted to ask him.
transcript: 我说有一天我看过他一篇文章，他写得特别好，他就回答了我本来想问他的一个问题。

translation: I had wanted to ask him, "what's next when you complete your travel around the world?"
transcript: 我曾经很想问他，就是说如果有一天你把世界走遍了都怎么办？

translation: At the end of that article, he wrote, “Life is too short for anyone to reach every corner of this planet.”
transcript: 他的那篇文章的结尾说：世界是走不完的，短的是人生。

translation: In 2007, I fell in love with cycling.
transcript: 2007年的时候我喜欢上骑自行车。

translation: It was also that year that I completed my first bicycle trip to the French city of Nice on the Azure coast.
transcript: 就在那个时候，我第一次骑车，骑完的那个骑到了在法国尼斯，蓝色海岸线。

translation: One night, I was sitting by the sea, drinking.
transcript: 那天晚上我一个人坐在那个海边喝酒。

translation: And I couldn’t feel more at ease.
transcript: 我忽然发现这个东西对我真的是很适合。

translation: What are we looking for all through our life?
transcript: 就是人一辈子在找一个什么东西呢？

translation: A key to unlocking our life.
transcript: 就是找一个密码，这个密码你找到之后你的人生就打开了。

translation: I never felt so free and assured of my life.
transcript: 我从来没有像在那一刻时候感觉我的人生被打开了。

translation: I thought I really loved it.
transcript: 我觉得我真的爱一个东西。

translation: Thus I said, “You won’t know how to love this world until you truly fall in love with something.” This is also what I want to share with you guys here.
transcript: 后来我说了过一句话，也是想今天跟大家分享的，就是说，当你真的当你真正爱上某样事物你才学会爱这个世界。

translation: But what is love?
transcript: 但什么是爱？

translation: This is something that must be figured out.
transcript: 这件事情得搞清楚。

translation: Try asking others what they love.
transcript: 很多人你问问他你说你爱什么。

translation: They’d say, “I love music, I love traveling or I love reading.”
transcript: 我喜欢，你爱，我爱音乐，我爱旅行，我爱读书。

translation: Then you’ll probably find that they only listen to pop songs on music charts and read best-sellers, which means they have the same poor taste as airport bookstores.
transcript: 然后你会发现他听的音乐就是那些流行排行榜的音乐，他看的书就是畅销排行榜上的书，就跟机场书店的品味一样差。

translation: Can that be described as “love”?
transcript: 他到底真的爱吗？

translation: I prefer to call it “interest”.
transcript: 我觉得这叫喜欢。

translation: When you love something, you feel like devoting yourself wholeheartedly to the sea.
transcript: 爱是你全身心的投向大海的那种感觉，就叫爱。

translation: After that trip, after cycling through a dozen more countries,  after reading over 100 books about bicycles,  when visiting the coolest bicycle shop in town wherever I go, when making friends with bicycle lovers from around the world, and when the images of bicycle were shown on my buttons, socks, book-ends and discs, I clearly felt my love for bicycles.
transcript: 在那一次之后，在我一个人骑过十几个国家之后，在我看过一百多本关于自行车的书之后，在我每到一个城市都去探访那些最酷的自行车店的时候，当我跟全世界的自行车的爱好者交朋友的时候，当我的袖扣、当我的袜子、当我的书立、当我的唱片全部变成自行车的时候，我知道我爱这个东西。

translation: My just published book is also about bicycles.
transcript: 我写的那本书也是关于自行车的。

translation: As an amateur writer, I am sorry for not having focused on something grander and greater.
transcript: 对不起，这个业余作家不太称职吧，应该写点更宏大的东西哦。

translation: I just took down my inspirations from bicycles.
transcript: 可是我只写了关于自行车给我的那些启发。

translation: I completed most of this book on the plane.
transcript: 我在写这本书的时候大部分是在飞机上。

translation: For a time, I travelled frequently on business trips, during which I did writing whenever I couldn’t fall asleep.
transcript: 那个时候我出差很多啊，睡不着的时候我就写。

translation: When I truly felt bicycle to be important part of my life, I made the decision to enter the industry of bicycle manufacturing.
transcript: 当我真正觉得这个自行车在我的生活变得如此重要的时候，我做了一个决定，我说我要去做自行车。

translation: I thus wrote a letter to our board of directors last October, telling them that I wanted to make my love of bicycles more meaningful.
transcript: 所以去年十月我给董事会写了一封信，我说我不想白白爱过自行车。

translation: There is only one way to prove your love of something, that is, to devote more time in perfecting it.
transcript: 证明爱的方式只有一种：那就是为它付出时间，为它做一些事情。

translation: I decided to devote all my rest passion and creativity to bicycles.
transcript: 我决定把我余生不多的热情和仅有的一点创造力交给自行车。

translation: And I believe someday you’ll also find your true love.
transcript: 我相信你们也会找得到。

translation: All through our life, we experience ups and downs.
transcript: 可能人一辈子最重要的事情，兜兜转转做很多很多的事情。

translation: Nevertheless, the most important of all is to find the very thing, the key to unlocking life.
transcript: 都是去找那样一个东西，找到那个密码，那个密码打开的时候你的人生从此打开。

translation: This is the first thing I learnt from cycling.
transcript: 自行车，这个是自行车教给我的第一件事情。

translation: The second thing I learnt form it is acceptance.
transcript: 那我再跟大家分享第二个，那就是接受。

translation: I was once caught in a rain when cycling.
transcript: 我曾经在一次骑自行车的时候，骑的骑的时候下起雨来。

translation: A sudden rain is the most terrible thing in long-distance cycling trips.
transcript: 你知道骑长途的时候最怕的一件事情就是下雨。

translation: What else?
transcript: 还有一件事情是什么？

translation: Roadside breakdown.
transcript: 车坏、抛锚。

translation: Anything more?
transcript: 还有一件事情是什么？

translation: Navigation failure.
transcript: 导航。

translation: Getting lost.
transcript: 的迷路。

translation: Are you puzzled by the last one?
transcript: 那最后一件事情你们是不是会觉得纳闷儿？

translation: With a mobile phone in hand, how can one get lost?
transcript: 有手机还会迷路吗？

translation: In my early days of cycling, mobile navigation wasn’t that accurate.
transcript: 但我们最早骑车的时候，那时候手机导航能力还很弱的。

translation: That day, I was lucky enough to encounter three of them once for all.
transcript: 可是我那天我运气特别好，三件事情都遇见了。

translation: I was blindly riding on my bicycle, not knowing which direction to go.
transcript: 当我在那个路上，很仓皇地跑来跑去骑来骑去找不到一个应该走的那个方向的时候。

translation: My map got wet in the rain, and I could not see it clearly.
transcript: 地图都被雨水打湿了，看不清楚。

translation: Cycling maps are of 1:100,000 scale and hard to read when wet.
transcript: 那种骑行的地图是一比一的，一公里比一厘米的那种，就被打湿了根本看不清楚。

translation: Then my body temperature began to drop.
transcript: 然后身体开始变得失温。

translation: Worse still, the bicycle broke down.
transcript: 而且车坏了。

translation: It eventually got fixed, although it took a long time.
transcript: 那幸虽然修好但是花了很长的时间。

translation: Noticing that my body temperature was declining, I became very nervous.
transcript: 身体开始变得失温的时候就会变得很紧张。

translation: Fortunately, I suddenly saw someone at the roadside.
transcript: 但我很幸运的，我在路上呢碰见了一个突然看见路边有一个人。

translation: With a cigar in his mouth and a wide-brimmed hat on his head, he was walking slowly back and forth in the rain, training a hunting dog.
transcript: 叼着雪茄，戴着一个宽檐帽，在训练猎犬，他慢悠悠地在雨里边走来走去。

translation: My original intention was to ask him the way.
transcript: 我本来过去找他问道的。

translation: But when I approached him, I couldn’t help asking, “Sir, why do you keep hunting in the rain? ”
transcript: 可是我忍不住先问了他一句，我说：“先生，这不是在下雨吗？你还打猎。”

translation: He looked at me and said, “Lad, who said only sunny day is nice and rainy day isn’t?”
transcript: 他就看着我也说：“年轻人，难道晴天是好天气，雨天就不是吗？”

translation: His words were what touched me most in the cycling trip.
transcript: 就这是骑行过程里边对我最触动最大的一件事情。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 所以你知道吗？

translation: My last long-distance journey was to Argentina.
transcript: 我最后一次骑五大洲的长途是去阿根廷。

translation: It was May, the beginning of rainy season in Argentina.
transcript: 五月份的时候，阿根廷正是雨季来临的时候。

translation: I went to the south and stayed there.
transcript: 我去南部，我到那里去住下来。

translation: And it began to rain the day I arrived.
transcript: 那天就已经下着雨了。

translation: The hotel owner asked what I was there for.
transcript: 然后酒店的老板问他问我来干嘛。

translation: I said I was there for cycling.
transcript: 我说我来骑车。

translation: He said, “Oh, didn’t you guys from the Northern Hemisphere know that it’s now rainy season in the South. Our season is just opposite to yours.”
transcript: 他说：“哦，你北半球的人不知道我们南半球现在要到雨季是吗？我们这个时候现在是要跟季节跟你们是相反的。”

translation: No laughter.
transcript: 你们听了不笑。

translation: It seems you guys have never been to the Southern Hemisphere.
transcript: 看来你们就没去过南半球。

translation: Haha.
transcript: 呵呵，呵呵。

translation: During that trip, every day, except one sunny day, I set off in the rain and reached a destination in the rain.
transcript: 我那一次骑行每一天都是在雨里边出发，每一天都在雨里边到达目的地，只有一天是晴天。

translation: Yet, this did not prevent me from enjoying the enchanting view of Argentina.
transcript: 可是一点都不妨碍我去欣赏阿根廷的美景。

translation: It was as fantastic and beautiful as described in Borges’ novels.
transcript: 真的就像博尔赫斯的那种，小说里边写的那种感受一样，非常的魔幻、非常的美。

translation: I could appreciate the beauty because I learnt that “sunny day is nice; so is rainy day.”
transcript: 对，因为我记得那句话，他跟我讲晴天是好天气，雨天也是。

translation: Indeed, what I saw in the rain along the way in the lake region in south Argentina was a dream-like wonderland.
transcript: 我相信呢那些我在雨里边走骑过的阿根廷南部的湖区的路线，真的像梦幻一般。

translation: And there’s no way one can experience it in sunny days.
transcript: 不会有人在晴天里边遇到那样有那样的感受，看到那样的美景，不会。

translation: Life is unpredictable.
transcript: 人生是变化无常。

translation: How can you expect it to be a barrier-free one?
transcript: 你怎么能期望你的人生永远是顺风顺道呢？

translation: No way.
transcript: 不可能的。

translation: Starting a business doesn’t necessarily lead you to a successful IPO.
transcript: 你以为你去创业你就会上市吗。

translation: My third, my first venture was near our university.
transcript: 我第三次创业，我第一次创业离咱们学校很近。

translation: When I failed, I only went out after 9pm everyday, for a night walk, with a bottle of Erguotou liquor in pocket, because I was too embarrassed to meet acquaintances.
transcript: 我输了的时候我每天晚上九点之后才出门，兜里装个二锅头出来散步，因为我没脸见人啊。

translation: I had believed myself smart enough to change the world.
transcript: 因为我以为自己是那么聪明，去改变世界的一个人。

translation: But I failed at the startup stage.
transcript: 可是我创业失败了。

translation: The worst of all was that no one even knew you failed.
transcript: 而且失败的时候多可怕你知道吗？都没有人知道你失败了。

translation: You guys are laughing. So uncompassionate!
transcript: 你看你们这些没有同情心的，还笑！

translation: There is a lot more that I learnt from cycling.
transcript: 骑车还教会我更多啦。

translation: When I was on a cycling trip, I often thought about such things as death can happen to anyone anytime.
transcript: 我觉得就当我在骑路上的时候我经常会想自己这些问题，就是对于一个人来讲，一个人生来讲，死亡也是你不知道它什么时候发生。

translation: That’s beyond our control just like we cannot decide whether to come to this world.
transcript: 就像我们来这个世上不是自己主动决定的一样。

translation: No one can predict that.
transcript: 这些东西没有谁可以预料。

translation: Life is so unpredictable.
transcript: 生活就是这么无常。

translation: When you think about that, life becomes so void and meaningless.
transcript: 尤其有时候想想，超非常非常的虚无。

translation: For dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return. The in-between period is too short to be wasted on the trivial.
transcript: 你从人生从零到零这个过程里边有一些东西真的是不重要的。

translation: One needs to find some reason to love this elusive world and makes it meaningful.
transcript: 但恰恰因为从零到零是这么的这么的虚无，你却要去找一点理由让自己能够爱这个世界。

translation: What else would I like to share with you?
transcript: 我还想跟大家分享的一点，是什么来着啊？

translation: You guys turn too fast.
transcript: 呵，你们把我的翻得太快了。

translation: Oh, right.
transcript: 对，咳，对，

translation: This is the last.
transcript: 这就是最后一句话了。

translation: In my opinion, there is no such thing as winner of life.
transcript: 就是其实哪里有什么人生的胜利者。

translation: It’s all about how to make choices on your life journey.
transcript: 只有你从零到零的那个路径的选择。

translation: And your choices constitute your lifestyle.
transcript: 那就是你生活方式。

translation: That is the only thing truly belonging to you and it has nothing to do with life condition, wealth, judgment of others, or whether you can change the world.
transcript: 那是唯一属于你的东西，那跟人生无关，那跟别人的眼光无关，那跟财富无关，那跟你是不是能否改变世界无关。

translation: I am happy that at a critical stage of my life I at least had such a reflection and that I could spend time on what I truly loved.
transcript: 我很开心啦，能够最后在人生一个重要的一个关键点里边，我愿意说我想起码我这个那个时间点上我想到了这件事情，我愿意把我的时间花给我让我给我带来真心快乐的一件事情。

translation: If I have to answer that question I raised in the beginning, I’d say the winner of life is someone who finds and does something that makes him or her really happy.
transcript: 如果说现在对我来讲我觉得非要给出一个答案的话，我会是说人生的最最重要的胜利，那就是让你得到发自内心的快乐。

translation: I remember a poet once said in his later years, “To think that once I was the same man did not embarrass me. ”
transcript: 曾经有一个诗人在他晚年的时候这样说，他说：想到故我今我同为一人，并不让我感到羞愧。

translation: Yes, it was said by Czeslaw Milosz in his later years.
transcript: 这是他老年的时候写的，米沃什写的。

translation: I regard it as an important yardstick for my life wisdom.
transcript: 我是觉得这可能是人衡量人生标准的一个非常重重要的一个智慧的一个标准吧。

translation: What can be controlled now that life is essentially unpredictable?
transcript: 我们一路走过来，那些结果既然不可预测，但是我们可掌控的是什么？

translation: It is what we should spend our short life-time on.
transcript: 就是我们用什么东西去走过这一段儿，这一段其实很短。

translation: I know I’m a very very lucky person, as I have found the thing I truly love and I have an ability and opportunity to pursue it.
transcript: 我知道自己是一个非常非常幸运的人，因为我找到了我喜欢的一个东西，而且我愿我有我有能力和机会去做这件事情。

translation: As far as I know, not many people have such courage.
transcript: 我也知道并不是所有人都有这样的勇气。

translation: So I’ll cherish it and also hope all of you can find the happiness of your own.
transcript: 我自己会珍惜，我也希望你们在座的诸位能找到自己的快乐。

translation: Thank you all!
transcript: 谢谢诸位！
